title: No feedback if cloning a world fails

content.raw:
Following the [Clone simulation](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=clone_simulation&cat=physics) tutorial, if you input a used or invalid port, the dialog closes silently and the logs make it look like a success:

~~~
$ cat ~/.gazebo/server-11345/default.log
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 9.0.0~pre1
Copyright (C) 2012 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org


(1516844530 498718802) [Msg] Waiting for master.
(1516844530 513366555) [Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
(1516844530 513978353) [Msg] Publicized address: 172.23.1.52
(1516844531 830701000) Init world[default]
(1516844540 473925712) Cloning world []. Connect to the server by typing:
	GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:11346 gzclient
(1516844549 827008790) Cloning world []. Connect to the server by typing:
	GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:11346 gzclient
(1516844620 747108056) Cloning world []. Connect to the server by typing:
	GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:11345 gzclient
(1516844741 157105037) Cloning world []. Connect to the server by typing:
	GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:0 gzclient
(1516844759 545103104) Cloning world []. Connect to the server by typing:
	GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:8080 gzclient
(1516844768 361576788) Cloning world []. Connect to the server by typing:
	GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:80 gzclient
louise@hadaly:/media/louise/TERA/code/gazeboA$ ps aux | grep gzserver
louise   24599 10.8  0.9 3220872 151860 pts/19 Sl   17:42   0:30 gzserver
louise   24751 12.7  0.8 3218644 137404 pts/19 Sl   17:42   0:34 gzserver /tmp/clone.11346.world
louise   25078 12.6  0.8 3218644 137080 pts/19 Sl   17:45   0:06 gzserver /tmp/clone.8080.world
louise   25147  0.0  0.0  14224   932 pts/18   S+   17:46   0:00 grep --color=auto gzserver
~~~
content.html:
Following the Clone simulation tutorial, if you input a used or invalid port, the dialog closes silently and the logs make it look like a success:

$ cat ~/.gazebo/server-11345/default.log
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 9.0.0~pre1
Copyright (C) 2012 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org


(1516844530 498718802) [Msg] Waiting for master.
(1516844530 513366555) [Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
(1516844530 513978353) [Msg] Publicized address: 172.23.1.52
(1516844531 830701000) Init world[default]
(1516844540 473925712) Cloning world []. Connect to the server by typing:
    GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:11346 gzclient
(1516844549 827008790) Cloning world []. Connect to the server by typing:
    GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:11346 gzclient
(1516844620 747108056) Cloning world []. Connect to the server by typing:
    GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:11345 gzclient
(1516844741 157105037) Cloning world []. Connect to the server by typing:
    GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:0 gzclient
(1516844759 545103104) Cloning world []. Connect to the server by typing:
    GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:8080 gzclient
(1516844768 361576788) Cloning world []. Connect to the server by typing:
    GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:80 gzclient
louise@hadaly:/media/louise/TERA/code/gazeboA$ ps aux | grep gzserver
louise   24599 10.8  0.9 3220872 151860 pts/19 Sl   17:42   0:30 gzserver
louise   24751 12.7  0.8 3218644 137404 pts/19 Sl   17:42   0:34 gzserver /tmp/clone.11346.world
louise   25078 12.6  0.8 3218644 137080 pts/19 Sl   17:45   0:06 gzserver /tmp/clone.8080.world
louise   25147  0.0  0.0  14224   932 pts/18   S+   17:46   0:00 grep --color=auto gzserver
